items.title: Human (Resources) Wrangler
items.content:
Would you like to take part in building the future of our distributed workforce? Automattic is a place like no other: our fast-growing team of 650+ works from home (or any other location they choose), in one of 59 countries, to democratize publishing and make the web a better place. Check out our Work With Us page for more info on how we work, our development process, and benefits. 

The Human League (externally known as HR) team’s goal is to ensure our company is the best place Automatticians have ever worked, making each person feel welcomed, included, valued, and respected. We are looking for a Human (Resources) Wrangler to join our team and help scale our distributed model as we grow. 

Some of your responsibilities will include managing global compensation, administering benefits programs, analyzing employee engagement data, developing learning opportunities and programs, being a strategic partner to Automatticians, and promoting employee relations. 

Do you have:

  • Experience with a lean, fast-growing, fast-paced software, internet, or creative startup?
  • An insatiable curiosity for new technology, gadgets, and streamlined processes?
  • Experience using WordPress?
  • Experience working with remote team members?
  • Experience implementing multinational compensation and benefits programs?
  • Experience supporting team leads and team members through all aspects of employment (onboarding, coaching others, brainstorming solutions, managing performance improvement plans)?
  • A passion for elegant, simple, automated solutions that keep operations running smoothly?
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills in English?
  • An ability to see opportunities to make the work environment better and the initiative to move forward with action?

items.title: Freedom Formula: Growth Accelerator Apprentice
items.content:
Growth Accelerator Apprentice

Posted Feb 15

Freedom Formula
Headquarters: United States
https://freedom-formula.breezy.hr/p/30addd227ecf-growth-accelerator-apprentice?source=weworkremotely

Are you a super driven person who enjoys or wants to learn the art and science of running a highly profitable online business - from anywhere in the world?

Are you looking to work with a group of rockstars all around the world, toward big scary goals that will actually make a dent in the world?

How would you like a bunch of autonomy, and the ability to learn how to run an extremely successful online business from the inside out... From people who have done it repeatedly?

Are you someone who can strategically take a project from start to finish? Kind of like a Chuck Norris Ninja-level Learner and Certified Badass...

Or even, do you know someone that sounds like this and want $5000 with which to do whatever the heck you want?

Good news! Please read on…

We run a really fast-growing company called Freedom Formula, where we help people create their first online business, fire their boss, and live the life that they actually want to live. And we are searching for the next rockstar to add to our tribe.

Got someone in mind? If you refer the rockstar who we end up working with for more than 2 months, we’ll toss you a cool $5k for connecting everyone. :)

We help people travel the world and spend more time with the people that mean most to them. Curious about what we do? Check us out here.

At the end of the day though, we're a small tribe of really smart and talented rockstars who are working together toward a common goal. And our goal is to completely transform the way people look at jobs they don’t love and entrepreneurship in America and around the world.

Our entire tribe is remote, so you get to work from anywhere. We are innovating left and right and we do work that changes lives.

We work hard, get shit done and are insanely informal.

Don't believe me? What if we did handstands?

BOOM. Handstands.

Anyway... Back to the good stuff.

We deliver an amazing product to help all of our students and are doing a very very amazing job at marketing and changing people’s lives... which has allowed us to grow really fast.

But, because of all the growth, some of us have gotten way too busy… Which is where you come in… If you want to go fast.

"I wanna go fast"

-Ricky Bobby

This is for you if:

  • You’re great at taking ideas and running with them, making sure they’re executed perfectly
  • You have an obsessive drive to grow and learn, and do things the right way the first time.
  • You are process driven, and good at problem-solving and figuring things out on your own with minimal direction… you can create your own structured work environment.
  • You actively read and seek out new learning from books or courses to get better at your role
  • You implement. And do so with minimal direction, doing a lot of your own research to find the best way to solve the problem at hand.
  • You want to learn how to run profitable internet businesses from the inside, and help build toward big scary goals.
  • Lastly and most importantly, you have an unquestioned work ethic. You have a very strong desire to work hard, put in extra time and learn in your off hours.
If you question your will to work hard, more than the normal 8-4 or 9-5 days, this probably isn’t the best position to apply for.

We hate normal jobs, and the 9-5 grind. We believe that regular jobs suck - which is why we never want to be a regular cut-and-paste team with cubicles... or holier-than-thou mission statements... while doing little for the world.

We have big, scary goals, and are surrounding ourselves with a small tribe of rockstars that are as excited as we are about the goal, so that there is no such thing as ‘work’. We enjoy every minute of it, and want the same for all our tribemates.

What you'll be doing...

You’ll be working with Evan and Benji directly, as well as our other tribemates, to ensure that any project that we start gets executed perfectly.

Sometimes this will mean taking a webinar idea and duplicating out a new marketing funnel for it, sometimes it will mean outlining awesome videos that we can make for our students, sometimes it will be finding badass ways to facilitate engagement within our community... And sometimes it will mean using your knowledge of our audience to help us create more resources to help our students achieve their dreams on Amazon and otherwise.

This means quickly looking at the goal and principles that drive our decision-making, then developing and executing on a plan to complete the task at hand quickly and effectively.

Day to day, your tasks will vary quite a bit. But they will ALL revolve around creating more value for our students - who are primarily first-time entrepreneurs. Ultimately, we are just looking for someone who is hungry and ready to learn a ton.

Because of how quickly we are growing, this opportunity will be a huge learning opportunity for someone that is eager to learn how to run profitable businesses online and impact a million lives in the process.

We need someone very driven to make sure we are maximizing all the opportunities we have and getting things done right fast, the first time.

As a long-term view… When you rock our socks off - this position will transition into an amazing long-term role in the company as we continue to grow.

What's in it for you?

  • This is a paid apprenticeship. We want someone who is committed and motivated who can deliver results. We also want that person to be compensated fairly.
  • You’ll be part of a fast-growing online company, and learn how we create products that people rave about, and authentic marketing to grow. You will get to work with a thriving and talented tribe, and learn from them.
  • It’s a very autonomous position. If you are self-motivated, you will love it. If you are not, it isn’t for you.
  • It is completely remote. Work from anywhere you want in the world, as long as you have internet.
  • And ideally, if things work out for both of us, you’ll move into a more permanent role in the tribe.
  • Ultimately, you will grow, incredibly and incredibly fast, both personally and professionally. And as you do, so will we.

A few other requirements and things you don’t need:

  • You’re able to work at least 20 hours per week to start, with the potential of going full time.
  • Age and experience don’t matter – We’re more interested in qualities: humble, hungry, smart, and entrepreneurial.
  • A crazy strong desire to learn and grow.
  • Must sometimes make, or be ok with frequent, jokes... :)

Interested?

If that sounds pretty awesome to you then here’s what to do next…


All applications will go through a vetting process and filtered through our hiring stages. If you’re serious about this, please show it.

The first step is to fill out the application questionnaire on the next page.

If you do it right and we like your application, you’ll get into round 2 with further instructions.

Good luck and I hope to talk to you soon!
Evan

Freedom Formula

Apply for this position

https://freedom-formula.breezy.hr/p/30addd227ecf-growth-accelerator-apprentice?source=weworkremotely

items.title: R&D Consultant
items.content:
DESCRIPTION

Experience real freedom at work and help exciting companies get funding for their tech with full support towards CIMA qualification.


Do you love the thought of working with a wide variety of entrepreneurs and making a tangible difference to their business? Does the idea of helping big name clients on the tech scene excite you? Would you like to join a diverse, self managing team where you can shape the future of the business from day one? If this sounds like your cup of tea, read on.


We are looking for future talent to join our tax credits client management team who are as good with clients as they are crunching numbers behind the scenes. If you have passion for technology, a good head for figures and a love of learning then you could help hundreds of companies a year bring the future closer.


By the end of your first year


You will be well on the way to a CIMA qualification, with the full support of the company
You'll be an authority in government funding and will have learned how to read a company's financial statements.
You will have built great relationships with a large number of companies, big and small, giving you a deeper understanding of how start-ups work.
You'll also have had the chance to change the future of GrantTree, by taking part in running your team and the business as a whole.
REQUIREMENTS

About you

You are passionate about technology.
Ideally, you'll have previously nurtured B2B client relationships, or done something equivalent (like run your own business).
You are keen to learn about basic accounting principles and how HMRC’s R&D Tax Credits scheme works.
You're totally comfortable producing detailed spreadsheets and written text.
You will build rapport with the founders and technical leaders of our client companies, so that you can represent their business in the best way when applying for government funding.
If you have a background in technology (particularly software) or finance (corporate tax or accountancy) this is a definite bonus.
About us

GrantTree was founded 6 years ago and employs 34 people. In our culture everyone has the freedom, power and trust to do great work. We call this open culture. Our open culture champions transparency and allows a flexible approach to work; it’s been successful for us so far, although it's not for everyone (check out our GlassDoor reviews to learn more).
BENEFITS

We believe that people should be rewarded fairly for the work they do. At GrantTree there is transparency over salaries and the way we work them out. For this role, this is likely to lie between £25k and £35k. We also provide access to health insurance, cycle to work, and we have an annual profit sharing scheme for the whole team (which can be taken as shares or cash).

Aside from money, we offer a place where you can be yourself. We want you to develop your skills and fulfil your potential. We have a flexible approach to working, and some of our staff work remotely most of the time. Our office near Old Street is bright and airy, with a well-stocked kitchen and a beautiful roof terrace. You can take up to 6 weeks as holiday each year.

Equal opportunities

Teams are stronger when they have a diverse range of people. Applications are welcomed from everyone, regardless of the categories they fit into. We also encourage talented ‘square pegs’, who don’t neatly fit into the person specification, to apply.

items.title: Full Time: Frontend Developer - Build the smartest way to buy a car (Remote - full time) at Unhaggle Inc. in Remote
items.content:
Unhaggle is currently the #1 web portal in Canada for new car buying. The data we provide powers our own tools and products, including our flagship consumer car buying service at Unhaggle.com and leading automotive portals including Yahoo Autos, MSN Autos, Autofocus, AutoGuide, Globe Drive, and others. We have also recently partnered with auto makers to launch a large eCommerce platform allowing the complete purchase of new cars online.

We are looking for Senior Front-end Developers with experience in web application development. This is a full-time remote position, we accept applications from anywhere in the world.

We use GitHub to manage tasks and code reviews as well as tools/services like Travis-CI, Docker, New Relic, Sentry, Browserstack, Stripe, Twilio, Solr and Redis.Our dev team is regularly connected in Slack for communication. We are constantly seeking the best tools available for our development team.

You will be primarily involved in the following projects/areas:

  • Our new eCommerce platform for new car buying, serving major car brands
  • Our web portal unhaggle.com
  • Several SaaS products we built for Enterprise clients
  • Widgets we built for third-party integration, they run in some of the most popular auto websites in Canada.
  • We take quality seriously and you should expect to be involved in well written code bases following industry standards and good software development practices.

Requirements:

  • At least 3 years of Javascript professional experience.
  • At least 1 year of experience with the Django Web Framework is a bigplus.
  • Strong web development experience: we expect that you know XHTML, CSS and Javascriptvery well. Hands on experience with Javascript frameworks is a big plus, specially Vue.js
  • Proficient and hands on experience with responsive web sites, including the Bootstrap library.
  • You care about writing semantic well formed code and paying attention to standards and good practices.
  • Experience using version control software, Git is a plus.
  • Track record of delivering completed projects, preferably web-based.
  • Easy-going personality. You will actively participate in design discussions and code review.

Bonus:

  • Some experience with Linux is a big plus. You will be asked to deploy changes to our dev machines that are based in Linux (Ubuntu server).
  • Some experience with Python and/or experience with Django would be a big plus.

We are helping consumers to get the best price on new cars in Canada and changing the industry along the way. Working at Unhaggle brings unique challenges, you will have the opportunity to leave a large footprint and have real impact in the product we ship every day to our customers.

No relocation available, we are a distributed team.

Please submit resume and cover letter to evandro@unhaggle.com

items.title: QlikView Evangelist at Qlik (London, UK)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Industry: Computer Software
Company size: 1k-5k people
Company type: Public

Job description

What makes us Qlik

We’re motivated to help people make discoveries in data, share insights, make decisions and act with confidence. Making a difference, both in small and large ways, is our passion. 

At the heart of Qlik is our Swedish soul, which guides everything from our culture and product design approach to our corporate social responsibility program. It’s what drives us to create a culture of innovation.

We believe data can change the world. And we believe people can, too

The QlikView Evangelist
As QlikView Evangelist for Qlik, you will be responsible for engaging with the QlikView customer based to highlight and promote the diverse benefits and use cases of QlikView.  You will be an external facing individual with expert level QlikView knowledge from a business and technical perspective.  You will help to drive and execute the go-to-market strategy for Qlik, with a primary focus on evangelizing QlikView to our customer base. This will entail engaging directly on Qlik Community at a technical level, supporting QlikView events and user groups, directly supporting sales engagements and developing positioning for QlikView.

In this highly visible role in a dynamic and rapidly growing worldwide organization, you will work closely with all areas of the business, including sales, technical pre-sales, product management, corporate marketing and our partner community.  You will help articulate and deliver Qlik’s value proposition regarding QlikView.  You will directly support the sales process through presentations, collateral creation, demonstrations, videos and other assets. The successful candidate will be an evangelist, a thought leader, spokesperson, and champion for QlikView.  They will be both analytical and creative and must have direct hands on experience with QlikView. 

How you will spend your time as our next QlikView Evangelist?

  • Create core messaging and subsequent marketing collateral, such as sales presentations, whiteboard discussions, data sheets, technical whitepapers, videos and case studies
  • Engage through multiple channels including, Qlik Community, Videos, in person meeting and remote meetings to help customer maximize their investment in QlikView
  • Create core messaging and subsequent marketing collateral, such as sales presentations, whiteboard discussions, data sheets, technical whitepapers, videos and case studies
  • Help develop product positioning and messaging based on deeply understanding Qlik’s product capabilities, competitors and customer requirements
  • Work closely with sales and pre-sales organizations to optimally position Qlik products and help close and retain customers
  • Create innovative product demonstrations highlighting a range of industry and application-specific data analysis challenges
  • Deliver exceptional technical architecture presentations to present technical features and business benefits of QlikView
  • Be the go to QlikView expert within Qlik from a solution and technical standpoint

You will be successful if you have

  • A Minimum of a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent. Advanced degree desirable
  • A Minimum of 5 years’ experience in relevant applications, relational database, web and client server technology.
  • Technical QlikView expertise, ability to create complex QlikView apps and manage QlikView server environments.
  • Excellent knowledge of systems and application design
  • Excellent interpersonal communication skills
  • The ability to conceptualize and execute appropriate marketing collateral to effectively communicate key differentiators
  • Experience in technical selling/marketing to large and diverse user communities. Strong consideration will be given to candidates that have spent some time in a technical customer-facing role.
  • Excellent written, presentation, and verbal communications skills; technical writing experience
  • Self-starter with the ability to define success metrics and drive self and organization to meet them
  • Ability to work as a remote employee as part of a geographically dispersed team
  • Results-oriented individual with an enthusiastic, can-do attitude and demonstrated pattern of accountable decision making
  • Attention to detail with the ability to prioritize, multi-task, and work within specific timeframes
  • Willingness to travel (estimate 20-30% travel)

Our way of giving back

To our communities, to the world, and to you is a core part of the culture at Qlik. We encourage our employees to participate in our numerous Corporate Responsibility Program initiatives.

Location/Mobility

We try to hire the best person for the job, whether they are on-site or virtual. A good cultural fit is the most important attribute for this role. A Qlik virtual workplace enables a team member to employ a self-motivated, disciplined, highly responsive approach in achieving team success.

About Qlik

Qlik® is the leading visual analytics platform and the pioneer of user-driven business intelligence. Its portfolio of cloud-based andon-premise solutions meets customers’ growing needs from reporting and self-service visual analysis to guided, embedded and custom analytics, regardless of where data is located. Customers using Qlik Sense®, QlikView® and Qlik® Cloud, gain meaning out of information from multiple sources, exploring the hidden relationships within data that lead to insights. Qlik does business in more than 100 countries with over 40,000 customers globally. Visit Qlik.com for more information. Visit Qlik.com for more information.

Qlik is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes / CVs submitted by search firms to any employee at Qlik via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Qlik. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Qlik as a result of the referral or through other means. By submitting personal data to Qlik for yourself or another, you acknowledge that (i) you have permission from that person to send to Qlik their data (if sending on behalf of another), and (ii) that Qlik may process this personal data.

Benefits

Competitive Salary
Amazing colleagues
Swedish Breakfast
Diverse employer

items.title: Buzz | Lead Node.JS Engineer | Onsite and REMOTE, INTERNS | Full-time | Mountain View, CA
items.content:
Buzz | Lead Node.JS Engineer | Onsite and REMOTE, INTERNS | Full-time | Mountain View, CA

Buzz is a community building tool for B2B companies to showcase their products and reach out to their audience directly.

Compensation: 90K per year + (%.5 - %1.0) vesting in 4 years. Numbers can vary based on experience and location.

Apply: info@getbuzz.io

We are looking for a Lead Node.js engineer.- Proficient with Javascript.- Lead development of backend components in Express JS, Node JS and related technologies.- Manage and lead backend development, undertake planning and approach for a feature.- Strong understanding of databases, normalization, caching. Knex.js and Sequelize experience is a plus. Design ER diagrams.- Experience with database optimizations and NoSQL databases is a plus.- Experience with real-time (e.g. Socket.io) is a plus.- JQuery experience is a plus.- Self-driven, diligent, values own and others' time. Understands importance of shipping.

Our day to day workflow involves planning, developing new backend features, update and optimize the backend architecture. We start by planning with the User Interface. The UI and its flows allows us to design the database models. We create ER diagrams to see the full picture in data models. Then we design the routes, urls, and define what needs to happen. We then write the logic that drives the feature. We take a holistic approach. We refactor features into sub-apps if needed. We write tests using Mocha and Chai. We measure response times, find bottlenecks and optimize.

We work remotely, using online tools. Our main office is in Mountain View, CA. We work flexible times, and encourage you to set up the best working environment for yourself.We are a small, tightly knit team who truly cares about this product. We are looking for someone who will be just as excited.

You have your own space, your time, lots of flexibility, and control. Your contributions will make direct impact on our product.

items.title: Senior Consultant (EDC - Vault) - Veeva - Remote
items.content:
Senior Consultant (EDC - Vault)
Veeva -Remote
Our Company

At 1,900 employees and growing and consistently strong financials (NYSE: VEEV), Veeva was named among the top fastest growing public technology companies on Forbes’ annual Fast Tech 25 list. We build innovative cloud solutions for some of the world’s largest pharmas and biotechs, and we need great people like you to make it happen.

Our Culture & People

Our core values are Employee Success, Customer Success, and Speed. We are innovators, collaborators, and thought leaders out to create best-in-class solutions that help our customers improve and extend human life. It’s genuine, straight-forward, and no fuss.

Job Summary

Tired of working with old EDC technology? Looking for an opportunity to change how clinical trials, data and data are managed? Veeva’s Vault Electronic Data Capture (EDC) application will truly change how the industry runs clinical trials and we want you on our team!
Veeva Systems is looking for Senior Consultants who have deep design, configuration, data management, and clinical trial expertise with a passion for helping customers transform the way they manage their clinical trial data and content with Vault EDC.
As a key member of our EDC Professional Services team, the Senior Consultant will be at the forefront of our mission and responsible for three main things:
Understand our customers’ clinical trial and protocol requirements and implement a study design with the Vault EDC application adhering to Good Clinical Data Management Practices and Veeva standards to optimize value.
Responsible for authoring all specification documents used by team members and configuring the study design during the development phase of the project.
Train and mentor customers and clinical sites who are working with the Vault EDC application or are new to clinical trials.
Opportunities are available across the United States for this role. The work location is remote within the U.S. Qualified U.S. based candidates are encouraged to apply.

Responsibilities
Work with customers to review and understand clinical protocol requirements and prepare, review and finalize all project specifications applying industry and Veeva best practices
Configure Veeva products during development
Support developers and testers during the project lifecycle
Support the requirements gathering and specification creation process for all study integrations
Conduct on-site or remote user acceptance testing with the customer including coordination of all feedback, resolution of issues and acceptance of the study
Create user acceptance testing scripts (if applicable)
Support go live activities for the study to ensure a smooth transition of the study to the customer
Review requirements as part of the change management process and update specifications and configurations as necessary with associated scoping activities
Support services pre-sales activities including review of customer requirements and scoping
Act as the customers trusted advisor to ensure that the study trial design is configured in such a way that it meets the customer's goals and offers the full benefits of Veeva’s EDC application
Engage with the training group to plan study training and deliver internal external training as needed at investigator meetings and clinical sites (if applicable)
Notify project management of project risks and develop contingency plans as necessary
Ensure customer success from beginning to end of the project life cycle
Assure process compliance with all regulatory and Veeva procedural requirements
Participate and contribute to process, product, or best practices initiatives
Adherence to all Veeva and EDC Services procedures and policies Requirements

5+ years’ direct experience working with EDC clinical software solutions in clinical operations, and/or trial management in a project management/consultant role
Experience in interpreting clinical protocols and translating requirements into software specifications including writing and reviewing technical documentation
Experience in a customer-facing role, preferably with a software professional services organization or consulting background is preferred
Working Knowledge of Clinical Trial processes across pharmaceuticals, device and/or biotech sectors, specifically as they relate to design, document, and data collection
Ability and willingness to “roll up your sleeves” to implement a clinical solution
Ability to quickly understand business requirements
Proven ability to work independently in a dynamic, fast-moving environment, but also as part of a team
Logical approach to problem solving
Ability to manage multiple tasks and project deliverables
Proven track record of meeting project timelines/deliverables and attention to detail, process, deadlines, and quality results
Demonstrated success with customers during project assessment, planning, development, training and implementation.
Excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills
Expert on life sciences compliance and computer systems validation requirements
Ability to travel 25-30% (may include international)
4-year college degree required
Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to be employed in the United States. Veeva Systems does not anticipate providing sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H-1B or TN status) for this employment position. Nice to Have

Life sciences industry experience and knowledge of clinical trial process preferred (pharmaceutical, biotech, medical device companies, CRO’s and academic & public health organizations).
Direct experience with EDC systems such as Medidata RAVE or Oracle/Phase Forward InForm
Experience working with system integrators for IVRS, medical coding, eSource, CTMS, eTMF, and other clinical technologies
Life Science, computer science or related degree
Familiarity with CDISC, ODM and other data management industry standards
JAVA experience and technical skills
SaaS/Cloud experience in the delivery of clinical trials
Enterprise experience and knowledge transfer for running clinical trials with EDC
Experience with training for clinical sites and at investigator meetings
Consulting experience
Locality to major life sciences customer hub (NJ; Boston, MA; San Francisco, CA; Philadelphia, PA; Chicago, IL)

Veeva is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances.

items.title: Associate Technical Consultant, Network (MDM) - Veeva - Remote
items.content:
Associate Technical Consultant, Network (MDM)
Veeva -Remote
Our Company

At 1,900 employees and growing, and consistently strong financials (NYSE: VEEV), Veeva was named among the top fastest growing public technology companies on Forbes’ annual Fast Tech 25 list. We build innovative cloud solutions for some of the world’s largest pharmas and biotechs, and we need great people like you to make it happen.

Our Culture & People

Our core values are Employee Success, Customer Success, and Speed. We are innovators, collaborators, and thought leaders out to create best-in-class solutions that help our customers improve and extend human life. It’s genuine, straight-forward, and no fuss. Job Summary

Veeva Network is the industry’s first complete, cloud-based customer master data solution that combines healthcare professional, healthcare organization, affiliations and reference data, software and stewardship services in a single solution that’s seamlessly integrated with Veeva CRM. Veeva Network harnesses the ‘network effect’ of life sciences companies electing to work together to contribute updates to master data repository. The result is accurate, complete and always up-to-date customer data within Veeva CRM.
As an Associate Technical Consultant, you will be a member of the Veeva Systems Professional Services group implementing the Veeva Network solution for companies in the life sciences industry. Participate in business and system integration process due diligence, solution design, integration analysis, and data quality assessment to help deliver successful Network implementations for Veeva customers. Collaborate with experienced Consultants and Sr. Consultants to develop consulting, technical analysis, and master data management skills.

Ideally located in France, Germany, Spain or UK.

Responsibilities

Support data quality assessment and data flow analysis of Customer systems
Support mapping of legacy systems and Customer attributes to the Network for migration
Provide subject matter expertise on the Veeva Network solution
Data migration between Customer systems and the Veeva application suite
Solution Testing and Documentation Requirements

Willing to travel up to 75%
Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential as position is client facing
Data Transformation and Data Loading Tools
Experience with database design and workflow
Bachelor’s degree in Business/ Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Math, Mechanical Engineering, or other similar degree or commensurate work experience is preferred
Fluent in English Nice to Have

Community involvement or organizational leadership experience is a plus
Exposure to the following technical disciplines: Web Services, ETL, SQL, Force.com
Additional European language(s)

items.title: Associate Technical Consultant, Network (MDM) - Veeva - Remote
items.content:
Associate Technical Consultant, Network (MDM)
Veeva -Remote
Our Company

At 1,900 employees and growing, and consistently strong financials (NYSE: VEEV), Veeva was named among the top fastest growing public technology companies on Forbes’ annual Fast Tech 25 list. We build innovative cloud solutions for some of the world’s largest pharmas and biotechs, and we need great people like you to make it happen.

Our Culture & People

Our core values are Employee Success, Customer Success, and Speed. We are innovators, collaborators, and thought leaders out to create best-in-class solutions that help our customers improve and extend human life. It’s genuine, straight-forward, and no fuss. Job Summary

Veeva Network is the industry’s first complete, cloud-based customer master data solution that combines healthcare professional, healthcare organization, affiliations and reference data, software and stewardship services in a single solution that’s seamlessly integrated with Veeva CRM. Veeva Network harnesses the ‘network effect’ of life sciences companies electing to work together to contribute updates to master data repository. The result is accurate, complete and always up-to-date customer data within Veeva CRM.
As an Associate Technical Consultant, you will be a member of the Veeva Systems Professional Services group implementing the Veeva Network solution for companies in the life sciences industry. Participate in business and system integration process due diligence, solution design, integration analysis, and data quality assessment to help deliver successful Network implementations for Veeva customers. Collaborate with experienced Consultants and Sr. Consultants to develop consulting, technical analysis, and master data management skills.

Ideally located in France, Germany, Spain or UK.

Responsibilities

Support data quality assessment and data flow analysis of Customer systems
Support mapping of legacy systems and Customer attributes to the Network for migration
Provide subject matter expertise on the Veeva Network solution
Data migration between Customer systems and the Veeva application suite
Solution Testing and Documentation Requirements

Willing to travel up to 75%
Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential as position is client facing
Data Transformation and Data Loading Tools
Experience with database design and workflow
Bachelor’s degree in Business/ Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Math, Mechanical Engineering, or other similar degree or commensurate work experience is preferred
Fluent in English Nice to Have

Community involvement or organizational leadership experience is a plus
Exposure to the following technical disciplines: Web Services, ETL, SQL, Force.com
Additional European language(s)

items.content:

GitHub is the best place to share code with friends, co-workers, classmates, and complete strangers. Over 24 million people use GitHub to build amazing things together across 67 million repositories. With the collaborative features of GitHub.com and GitHub Business, it has never been easier for individuals and teams to write faster, better code.

To learn more about who we are, our engineering culture, and whether this is the right place for you, read our Key Values profile: https://www.keyvalues.com/github

Some of our open positions:

* Elasticsearch Infrastructure Engineer - Remote, US: https://boards.greenhouse.io/github/jobs/877285#.Wmkka5M-dTY

* Engineering Manager, Atom: https://boards.greenhouse.io/github/jobs/983209#.WmkkbZM-dTY

Tech Stack: GitHub is a Rails 4 application that is composed of a large monolith and a constellation of services written in Ruby, Go, and a handful of other languages. We primarily rely on MySQL for persistent storage, Redis for temporary storage, and, as you might expect, a lot of git repositories. We rely on Kubernetes for container orchestration.

items.content:
ReferWell | node.js contractor - 8-12 weeks | New York, NY / Upstate SC | REMOTE OK (US only), Contract | $50-$60 /hour

ReferWell ( https://www.referwell.com/ ) is delivering better outcomes for patients and better referrals for specialist and primary care doctors in the US.

Our main office is in Manhattan, and we have a developer presence near Spartanburg, SC, where we intend to set up a dev-focused office later this year.

The immediate need is for a contractor to assist in building out a hypermedia API for an ongoing partner integration. The services making up this API run on a stack using docker, mysql, redis, and node.js. The core need is for someone who is comfortable writing in a modern JS style (async/await, unit and bdt, etc), who avoids slow and unsafe patterns with SQL, and who has some experience with docker, ssh, git, and so forth.

Familiarity with any of JSON Hypermedia, OAuth2, AWS administration, microservices, Ansible, Consul, or Jenkins is a plus.

The contract is expected to last 8-12 calendar weeks, though number of hours for each week may vary. We plan to get started in February, so the decision process should be short.

As mentioned, we will be setting up a physical office in SC in 2018; for a developer located in the Upstate, this contract could lead into a FT position.

Please use careers.dev@referwell.com to ask questions or send your details for consideration.

items.title: Fast Paced, Nice Generalist to supercharge our growth
items.content:
About Koru Kids
Koru Kids is London’s fastest growing childcare brand. We’re making it easier and more affordable for families to access high quality childcare.

Our after school service matches parents in London with the top 10% of student nannies in London and our nanny share service helps families to share nannies with other local families.

We don’t just believe in providing outstanding childcare to families, we are all about using technology to make it seamless for parents. We’ve been blown away by the response from parents and are consistently beating our growth targets.

We are backed by fantastic investors, including top venture capitalists and business angels such as Michael Pennington the founder of Gumtree. We won the South of England region in the ‘Best of Britain’ awards 2017, and are currently shortlisted for several awards: the UK Business Awards 2017 as ‘Disruptor of the Year’, and in the Best Women Awards 2017 as ‘Best New Business’, ‘Best Technology’ and ‘Best company working with children and families’.

About the Team
We have an informal, hard-working and kind team culture. We’re all passionate about our mission and are determined to create the world’s leading childcare brand. Every team member plays a vital role in achieving our goals and we work together so we can get there quicker. Our approach is fast paced – we are constantly challenging, testing and adapting the way we do things.

Our founder is Rachel Carrell, the former CEO of DrThom.com, the world’s largest online doctor service, which she grew to over 1.3m paying users in 3 countries. She’s an Oxford alumn, ex-McKinsey, a Rhodes Scholar and a WEF Young Global Leader. Rachel’s joined by an amazing team with backgrounds including Cambridge, UCL, BCG, KPMG, and some of London’s top startups.

We take great care with who we hire and all team members are superbly talented and most importantly really nice! If you’re brilliant AND humble, you’ll fit right in.

About the role
We have huge growth plans for the business and we need someone to help us take our acquisition to the next level.

You don’t need any prior marketing experience but you do need to be pro-active, a fast learner and not afraid to try new things.

This role will suit someone who enjoys testing new ideas, validating them and gets a kick out of figuring out how to make things work. You need to be analytical and comfortable with numbers. You’ll be organised, comfortable working at a fast pace and able to task switch.

You'll be comfortable taking ownership and be responsible for all our acquisition channels including Facebook, Google, SERP, Referrals and more.

You’ll also spend time working on customer-facing operations. This means speaking to mums (sometimes dads and nannies, but usually mums) on the phone, and emailing/texting them. This will probably be at least 20% of the job. You’ll get to know our parents, what their needs are and therefore how we can best acquire new ones.


Your normal hours of work will be 9am to 6.30pm on weekdays but there may be times when late night are required to cope with spikes in demand. We know you have a private life and other commitments and we work as a team to make sure everyone has a good balance. You’ll normally work from our offices near Old St, although if you like to occasionally work from home that’s totally fine too we support flexibility as long as the work gets done!

3 reasons this role is great:
1. You will learn a TON. Marketing will be your main focus, but you’ll get plenty of exposure to operations, product, technology and other aspects of the business. You’ll learn how to found a business, about operations, marketing, technology, and finance.
2. You’ll be making a huge difference to the everyday lives of parents in London. We’re building a business that will profoundly benefit children, women, and families.
3. We’re well-connected in the startup world, so working with us will open lots of doors for you even if you leave. We’ve got a strong track record of helping people we’ve worked with

About you
We’re after an all-rounder who is clever, practical, positive and nice. We don’t mind what degree you’ve done, as long as you’ve done well in it. We’ll also be looking for evidence of spark and energy in the extracurricular stuff you’ve done.

Ideally you will have about 1-2 years of experience in the workforce already.

You need to have excellent English – you’ll be writing compelling and concise copy to catch parents attention.

You’ll be a key member of our team, and you’ll get all the training, coaching and support you need to do these things well.

Essential skills
• You’re able to write clearly, simply and accurately, with perfect spelling and grammar
• You like working with numbers and data. We love people who love analysis
• You’re comfortable with speaking to new people, both in person and on the phone
• You’re emotionally intelligent. Although you’ll like to talk, the most important thing you’ll do is listen. Choosing childcare is an emotional decision, and you’ll need to help parents through the process
• You’re a problem-solver. As we are a young company, there aren’t many fixed processes yet. That means you can create new processes, make suggestions, and tell us we’re doing things wrong
• You roll with it. You understand that startups are unpredictable environments. You are comfortable with a degree of chaos
• You’re nice. You get that no player is bigger than the team. You fit right into our culture of supporting and helping each other.

Skills/experience that are not essential but would be fantastic
• Passion for design or photography (you would need your own equipment, but again we could certainly create opportunities for you to practice)

Benefits
• Competitive salary dependent on experience
• We work from a beautiful co-working space near Old St in central London. The office has a gym and showers, bike storage, free snacks and drinks, and a programme of social events.

items.title: IT Security and Mobility Consultant - Microsoft solutions - Threatscape - Remote
items.content:
IT Security and Mobility Consultant - Microsoft solutions
Threatscape -Remote
Full-time, Permanent

Threatscape’s mission is to secure and protect our customers’ data , making it available to employees at all times without compromise to its integrity.

How do we do it?

We provide business‐critical IT security solutions and services to large corporate, multinational and state or ganisations in the UK, Ireland, Europe and beyond.

Our expertise in delivering, supporting, maintaining and managing cyber security solutions makes us very much an extension of our customers ’* *IT Security teams . We strive for operational excellence coupled with advanced security technologies from global vendors. Threatscape’s high level of vendor accreditation and close vendor relations ensures our customers benefit from the best in service delivery and commercial offerings.

We are growing our Irish and UK operations and are looking to hire an experienced engineer to be in charge of the Microsoft projects.

Before we tell you about the technical skills needed for the role, let us tell you about the personality that will be a great fit with both the type of company we are and the team.

We are a great bunch of people with a good sense of humour, and nice to work with.

We are very successful and highly regarded in our industry and by our clients, and this is based not only on our technical expertise but also because we truly put our customers first and have a flexible approach to work . So, problem anticipation, problem solving and rolling up our sleeves to get things done and sorted are definitely qualities that describe us and what you need to have in order to join us.

Soft skills you need:

  • Customer focus
  • Excellent at building relationships
  • Flexible approach to work
  • Good at taking initiatives and being proactive (there’s no hand holding here!)
  • You need to have a passion for technology and cyber security – you need to want to learn. The entire team is hands on and working on projects so again there’s no hand holding.

That’s what cyber security is about. It evolves constantly, so do we in order to stay ahead of the threat landscape.

So in that role – Microsoft Consultant (Security solutions) you will be in charge of a variety of tasks related to Microsoft Security Solutions (ATA, CAS, AIP, ATP etc).

Technology focus:

Your primary focus will be to work with those solutions in our portfolio which deal with

  • Identity and Access Management (such as Azure Active Directory – AAD),
  • Threat Protection (Advanced Threat Analytics, Windows defender Advanced Threat Protection, Office 365 Threat Protection and Threat Intelligence),
  • Information Protection (Azure Information Protection, Office 365 Data Loss Prevention, Microsoft Cloud App Security, Office 365 Advanced Security Management, Microsoft Intune),
  • Security Management (Azure Security Centre, Office 365 Security and Compliance Centre, Windows Defender Advanced Security Centre).

Responsibilities:

  • Your responsibilities will be quite broad from presales, to implementation, training, troubleshooting and support.
  • You will help design and deliver services for those security solutions. You will execute PoCs
  • You will do presales support by participating to clients’ meetings.
  • You will implement the technology with existing engineers and look to build a team to deliver on an ongoing basis
  • You will help design and implement support for Microsoft services.

Our partnership and work with Microsoft will evolve with time so be prepared for 2 days not looking the same.

If that’s the challenge you are looking for the we’d love to hear from you.

You need to have a fair amount of experience with Microsoft security solutions including presales, deployment, support, documentation etc.

Oh and just a few things:

  • You need to have an excellent fluent level of English.
  • The work will involve travelling within the UK and to Ireland from time to time

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

  • Identity and Access Management (such as Azure Active Directory – AAD),
  • Threat Protection (Advanced Threat Analytics, Windows defender Advanced Threat Protection, Office 365 Threat Protection and Threat Intelligence),
  • Information Protection (Azure Information Protection, Office 365 Data Loss Prevention, Microsoft Cloud App Security, Office 365 Advanced Security Management, Microsoft Intune),
  • Security Management (Azure Security Centre, Office 365 Security and Compliance Centre, Windows Defender Advanced Security Centre).

Responsibilities:

  • Your responsibilities will be quite broad from presales, to implementation, training, troubleshooting and support.
  • You will help design and deliver services for those security solutions. You will execute PoCs
  • You will do presales support by participating to clients’ meetings.
  • You will implement the technology with existing engineers and look to build a team to deliver on an ongoing basis
  • You will help design and implement support for Microsoft services.

Our partnership and work with Microsoft will evolve with time so be prepared for 2 days not looking the same.

If that’s the challenge you are looking for the we’d love to hear from you.

You need to have a fair amount of experience with Microsoft security solutions including presales, deployment, support, documentation etc.

Oh and just a few things:

  • You need to have an excellent fluent level of English.
  • The work will involve travelling within the UK and to Ireland from time to time

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

items.content:
IT Security and Mobility Consultant - Microsoft solutions
Threatscape -Remote
Full-time, Permanent

Threatscape’s mission is to secure and protect our customers’ data , making it available to employees at all times without compromise to its integrity.

How do we do it?

We provide business‐critical IT security solutions and services to large corporate, multinational and state or ganisations in the UK, Ireland, Europe and beyond.

Our expertise in delivering, supporting, maintaining and managing cyber security solutions makes us very much an extension of our customers ’* *IT Security teams . We strive for operational excellence coupled with advanced security technologies from global vendors. Threatscape’s high level of vendor accreditation and close vendor relations ensures our customers benefit from the best in service delivery and commercial offerings.

We are growing our Irish and UK operations and are looking to hire an experienced engineer to be in charge of the Microsoft projects.

Before we tell you about the technical skills needed for the role, let us tell you about the personality that will be a great fit with both the type of company we are and the team.

We are a great bunch of people with a good sense of humour, and nice to work with.

We are very successful and highly regarded in our industry and by our clients, and this is based not only on our technical expertise but also because we truly put our customers first and have a flexible approach to work . So, problem anticipation, problem solving and rolling up our sleeves to get things done and sorted are definitely qualities that describe us and what you need to have in order to join us.

Soft skills you need:

  • Customer focus
  • Excellent at building relationships
  • Flexible approach to work
  • Good at taking initiatives and being proactive (there’s no hand holding here!)
  • You need to have a passion for technology and cyber security – you need to want to learn. The entire team is hands on and working on projects so again there’s no hand holding.

That’s what cyber security is about. It evolves constantly, so do we in order to stay ahead of the threat landscape.

So in that role – Microsoft Consultant (Security solutions) you will be in charge of a variety of tasks related to Microsoft Security Solutions (ATA, CAS, AIP, ATP etc).

Technology focus:

Your primary focus will be to work with those solutions in our portfolio which deal with

  • Identity and Access Management (such as Azure Active Directory – AAD),
  • Threat Protection (Advanced Threat Analytics, Windows defender Advanced Threat Protection, Office 365 Threat Protection and Threat Intelligence),
  • Information Protection (Azure Information Protection, Office 365 Data Loss Prevention, Microsoft Cloud App Security, Office 365 Advanced Security Management, Microsoft Intune),
  • Security Management (Azure Security Centre, Office 365 Security and Compliance Centre, Windows Defender Advanced Security Centre).

Responsibilities:

  • Your responsibilities will be quite broad from presales, to implementation, training, troubleshooting and support.
  • You will help design and deliver services for those security solutions. You will execute PoCs
  • You will do presales support by participating to clients’ meetings.
  • You will implement the technology with existing engineers and look to build a team to deliver on an ongoing basis
  • You will help design and implement support for Microsoft services.

Our partnership and work with Microsoft will evolve with time so be prepared for 2 days not looking the same.

If that’s the challenge you are looking for the we’d love to hear from you.

You need to have a fair amount of experience with Microsoft security solutions including presales, deployment, support, documentation etc.

Oh and just a few things:

  • You need to have an excellent fluent level of English.
  • The work will involve travelling within the UK and to Ireland from time to time

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

items.title: Hotjar: Hotjar Hero (Americas)
items.content:
Hotjar Hero (Americas)

Posted Jan 18

Hotjar
Headquarters: Malta
https://careers.hotjar.com/o/hotjar-hero-us/?source=WeWorkRemotely

Note: Although this is a remote position, due to the necessary overlap with Europe we are seeking candidates in EST only.
 

The Hotjar Hero team supports thousands of users and customers in over 180 countries by providing world class service, documentation, and training. The Hero team also works closely with our product teams to help prioritize and define changes to Hotjar to continuously improve the overall user experience.

We are looking for extremely organized and self driven Hotjar Heroes to work in a remote role with a fast growing startup.

All new Heroes receive extensive technical, product, and marketing training – as well as a yearly budget for additional training and self development. With this knowledge you will help our users set up and use Hotjar features to improve the experience and performance of their sites and apps. This is a great opportunity to develop your career by learning new skills and joining a fast-growing startup.

 

About You

Empathy for the win. Our users come from a wide range of backgrounds and have a wide range of technical abilities. Hotjar Heroes need to be able to put themselves in the users’ shoes to help them resolve any questions while at the same time empowering users with knowledge.
 

Detail is key. Troubleshooting an issue isn’t always straightforward. Since our tool can get pretty technical, obsessing over details really helps. If you can’t solve it, that’s ok - just provide enough details to help the engineers as they investigate further.
 

Independent mindset. As a remote team, autonomy and self-motivation is necessary. One of our core values is Honesty. We don’t use apps to measure whether or not you're working, we simply trust you. Are you up to the challenge?
 

Learning is growing. Hotjar is always adding new capabilities and improving the way our tool works. This means Hotjar Heroes are always learning. Plus, it doesn’t stop there - everyone at Hotjar aims to learn 1% each day (machine learning, anyone?).
 

Go Team! Though we are spread across the world, our team is always in contact. We hold daily scrums, weekly planning, and company wide demos. We need to be prepared to step up if a team member is out. Or share a new idea we have for how to make the team or the company better. Being a team player is vital to the role of Hero.

 

What Hotjar Heroes do...

  • Creating 'WOW' moments by consistently delivering world-class support with empathy and understanding
  • Promptly interacting with users who contact us via our support channels
  • Accurately identifying, analyzing, and resolving technical and non-technical issues in a timely manner.
  • Updating the pipeline of user suggestions and feedback to improve Hotjar.
  • Escalating more complex problems to appropriate internal resources.
  • Writing (and updating) documentation for internal and external knowledge bases.
  • Occasionally providing demonstrations or webinars to users.
  • Working with Lead Heroes on gathering data from user communications on user needs and pain points.
 

Compensation Range

The budgeted compensation range for this role is $44,000 to $60,000 annually. Ranges are based on market research and are equitable to other roles within Hotjar. The actual compensation offered to a successful candidate will be based on relative experience and skills. At this time we are only able to provide official employment status to those located in Malta. All other candidates will join our team as full-time consultants and will be responsible for paying any taxes or applicable fees where they reside.

Requirements

Must have:

  • Very strong English communication skills – both written and spoken. If you are fluent in other languages, tell us! German, French, Spanish and Japanese will be considered as assets.
  • Familiarity with the basics of HTML, CSS, Javascript, and using browser developer tools.
  • Ability to effectively communicate complex concepts that empowers our users without making them feel small.
  • Be able to work independently - accountable for your own actions and able to act with both urgency and integrity.
  • Experience working in technical support roles and teams, Agile experience a plus.
  • Desire and drive to always be learning.
  • Ability to work independently and within a team towards both personal and shared work goals.
  • Must submit to a background check confidentially processed by our third party.
 

Nice to have:

  • Proficiency with HTML, Javascript, and debugging using the browser developer tools
  • Experience in codifying and maintaining customer process documentations  
  • Experience working with CRO, Marketing, or Design Agencies
  • Experience working remotely

Apply for this position

Please apply via https://careers.hotjar.com/o/hotjar-hero-us/?source=WeWorkRemotely

items.title: Bilingual (Japanese) Software Consultant | Tokyo, Japan
items.content:
*INTRODUCTION*

Hello. We are a well-established, high-growth, investor-backed consulting firm. Very much boutique, with an almost startup-like approach and feel, we have big company ambitions. And a track record to prove it.

*OUR CULTURE?*

Tech-savvy, innovative, entrepreneurial, collaborative. Our consultants are fiercely loyal and this is borne out by a very low attrition rate.

*WHAT DOES A TYPICAL DAY LOOK LIKE?*

* Imagine owning the proof of concept, design, architecture, development and delivery of client solutions.
* Imagine engaging with developers, business analysts, change professionals, project managers and other stakeholders.
* Imagine being the face of the firm, showcasing solutions, outlining benefits, identifying future business opportunities.
* Imagine using your business acumen to ensure technical implementations are fit for purpose.

*WHAT'S INTERESTING ABOUT THE ROLE?*

In many ways you will feel like your own boss. You will need to be independent, adaptable and able to travel extensively throughout APAC and at times, globally, to client sites. The role will bring lots of autonomy and flexibility including a significant opportunity for remote working.

*WHAT ARE THE CHALLENGES?*

If you enjoy the formal structure of a corporate environment then this is not for you. You will need be self-motivated and versatile enough to wear multiple hats i.e. consultant, project manager, business analyst, technician, mentor, advisor. You will have a network of consultants to support you in the early days but thereafter you will be expected to stand on your own two feet.

*WHAT'S MY BACKGROUND?*

You come from a technical hands-on development (.NET, Java, C# or similar) environment but now operate in a more strategic, consultative, client-facing role which might encompass disciplines such as solution architecture, business analysis, project management and the like.

*PROGRESSION?*

This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of an exciting success story and to grow with a firm that has world-class ambitions. In many ways progression will be exactly what you make it.

*WHAT TECHNICAL SKILLS WILL I NEED?*

* Programming background in .NET, Java, C# or similar.
* An understanding of object-orientated, structured development methodologies.

*WHAT BUSINESS KNOWLEDGE WILL I NEED?*

* Good understanding of project management, software development life cycles, structured programming methods and controls.
* An affinity for consulting, business analysis, change management, process re-engineering, business transformation.
* Prior experience of designing and implementing documented, supportable and extensive developments for clients.
* Able to solve business and technical challenges by using innovative and well-planned approaches.

*SOFT SKILLS?*

* Highly personable, engaging, client-facing, confident, credible, articulate, consultative, affable, charismatic.
* Gravitas and credibility to face off to senior business stakeholders, able to instil confidence.
* Sixth sense for identifying, troubleshooting and remediating issues, both business and technical.
* Sound commercial nous coupled with excellent stakeholder management skills and a strong technical background.
* Able to tailor a message to the audience, combined with exceptional presentation skills.

items.title: Technical Consultant fluent in English, Japanese and .NET? | Tokyo, Japan.
items.content:
*INTRODUCTION*

Hello. We are a well-established, high-growth, investor-backed consulting firm. Very much boutique, with an almost startup-like approach and feel, we have big company ambitions. And a track record to prove it.

*OUR CULTURE?*

Tech-savvy, innovative, entrepreneurial, collaborative. Our consultants are fiercely loyal and this is borne out by a very low attrition rate.

*WHAT DOES A TYPICAL DAY LOOK LIKE?*

* Imagine owning the proof of concept, design, architecture, development and delivery of client solutions.
* Imagine engaging with developers, business analysts, change professionals, project managers and other stakeholders.
* Imagine being the face of the firm, showcasing solutions, outlining benefits, identifying future business opportunities.
* Imagine using your business acumen to ensure technical implementations are fit for purpose.

*WHAT'S INTERESTING ABOUT THE ROLE?*

In many ways you will feel like your own boss. You will need to be independent, adaptable and able to travel extensively throughout APAC and at times, globally, to client sites. The role will bring lots of autonomy and flexibility including a significant opportunity for remote working.

*WHAT ARE THE CHALLENGES?*

If you enjoy the formal structure of a corporate environment then this is not for you. You will need be self-motivated and versatile enough to wear multiple hats i.e. consultant, project manager, business analyst, technician, mentor, advisor. You will have a network of consultants to support you in the early days but thereafter you will be expected to stand on your own two feet.

*WHAT'S MY BACKGROUND?*

You come from a technical hands-on development (.NET, Java, C# or similar) environment but now operate in a more strategic, consultative, client-facing role which might encompass disciplines such as solution architecture, business analysis, project management and the like.

*PROGRESSION?*

This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of an exciting success story and to grow with a firm that has world-class ambitions. In many ways progression will be exactly what you make it.

*WHAT TECHNICAL SKILLS WILL I NEED?*

* Programming background in .NET, Java, C# or similar.
* An understanding of object-orientated, structured development methodologies.

*WHAT BUSINESS KNOWLEDGE WILL I NEED?*

* Good understanding of project management, software development life cycles, structured programming methods and controls.
* An affinity for consulting, business analysis, change management, process re-engineering, business transformation.
* Prior experience of designing and implementing documented, supportable and extensive developments for clients.
* Able to solve business and technical challenges by using innovative and well-planned approaches.

*SOFT SKILLS?*

* Highly personable, engaging, client-facing, confident, credible, articulate, consultative, affable, charismatic.
* Gravitas and credibility to face off to senior business stakeholders, able to instil confidence.
* Sixth sense for identifying, troubleshooting and remediating issues, both business and technical.
* Sound commercial nous coupled with excellent stakeholder management skills and a strong technical background.
* Able to tailor a message to the audience, combined with exceptional presentation skills.
* International outlook and exposure, you will most likely have worked abroad at some point.
* Bilingual Japanese/English skills are essential.

*THE NUMBERS?*

JPY 12,000,000 + excellent benefits + share options.

*INTERESTED?*

Please apply including a copy of your CV and cover letter (yes we're a bit old school like that). We look forward to hearing from you.

Location: Remote

items.title: Fundraisers / co-workers - to Combat Climate Change
items.content:
Fundraisers / co-workers - to Combat Climate Change at ACT Cooperative Corporation AS

Oslo, Remote · Cofounder
Skills
Sales, Social Media Marketing, Sales and Marketing, Communication Skills, Digital Marketing, Crowdfunding
Compensation
No Salary
0.5%–1.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

ABOUT ACT
ACT’s Core Infrastructure team is seeking an iOS developer to help build the zero carbon footprint future version of our planet. Sounds interesting? Read on.

ACT’s Core Infrastructure team is seeking fundraisers to help build the zero carbon footprint future version of our planet. Sounds interesting? Read on.

We believe that the core problem of global warming is lack of global collaboration. Our goal is to support and enhance global collaboration facilitated by an ecosystem of carefully crafted software systems. Just like Wikipedia is a computer facilitated collaboration platform around building the world’s biggest encyclopedia – so will ACT enable collaboration around green shopping and help humans ACT together for a sustainable planet so that we can do our part to end global warming and also support fair trade.

- ACT is software technology with smart gamification to connect consumers around sustainable shopping and collaboration.
- The immediate goal of ACT is to reduce climate gasses and possibly be the “solution” to global climate change.
- ACT is a role model of a democratic organization: Max factor of 8 between highest and lowest paid, all employees has 1 vote, no person or organization can own voting shares (i.e. no external organization can control ACT, which is important to keep us a partner of independent advice).
- All software is expected to be open source and free, so that all can take action.

We have just finished a major design phase and now wish to start serious development of the software platform. We are looking to tell the world about our extraordinary solution for ACTion, that we believe will change the way we manage global climate change almost overnight.

We need to strengthen our team, our advisory board and council with experienced resources within multiple fields: Management, Communication/journalism/marketing, Financial management, Fundraising, Life cycle analysis & research, Graphical design, Web development, Mobile development, Backend development, Networking.

WHY ACT?
Have you ever thought that it is impossible to solve global climate change and that your effort would mean so little?

What if you had the chance to work with one of the most ambitious climate change projects? We believe that ACT is one of the most hands-on solutions to mitigating climate change. These might sound like just 'great words,' but do the math yourself: E.g. If only 1700 people decided to use ACT to find the least fossil fuel consuming goods, service alternatives and register their purchases it would deliver a combined purchasing power of 63 million USD/year after tax*, which is the same amount Norway uses to conserve the Amazonas rainforest! And those 1700 people could decide to ACT tomorrow!

* Assuming a salary of 37,000 USD/year after tax.

JOB DESCRIPTION, FUNDRAISERS / MARKETEERS
ACT is now selling shares and applying for funding with various organizations. We need 2 highly motivated FUNDRAISERS / MARKETEERS to join our Core team in this exciting phase that will have a serious impact on sustainability of our planet.

At best the following requirements apply to you:

- You have applied and won support from Innovasjon Norge on multiple occasions.
- You have applied and won support from various other foundations.
- You have experience from selling shares.
- You have a good network.
- You have a good command of English.

The fundraisers will work closely with co-founders and be a part of our small team of entrepreneurs with a flat organizational structure. Since the company is in an early phase you will be able to shape your role in the company exactly how you like it best.

WORK PLACE
This job should at best be carried out as much as possible in co-location with ACT in Oslo, but we are open to remote work too.

APPLICATION
Please send your CV and some words introducing yourself, why you want to work with ACT, highlight relevant previous experience and your current situation.

For more information about this job and ACT please contact:

Thomas Jepsen
President, Founder & CTO
ACT Cooperative Corporation AS
